description: A schema for Appium configuration files

$schema.description: The JSON schema for this file

server.description: Configuration when running Appium as a server

address.description: IPv4/IPv6 address or a hostname to listen on
address.title: address config

allow-cors.description: Whether the Appium server should allow web browser connections from any host
allow-cors.title: allow-cors config

allow-insecure.description: Set which insecure features are allowed to run in this server's sessions. Features are defined on a driver level; see documentation for more details. Note that features defined via "deny-insecure" will be disabled, even if also listed here. If string, a path to a text file containing policy or a comma-delimited list.
allow-insecure.title: allow-insecure config

base-path.description: Base path to use as the prefix for all webdriver routes running on the server
base-path.title: base-path config

debug-log-spacing.description: Add exaggerated spacing in logs to help with visual inspection
debug-log-spacing.title: debug-log-spacing config

default-capabilities.description: Set the default desired capabilities, which will be set on each session unless overridden by received capabilities. If a string, a path to a JSON file containing the capabilities, or raw JSON.
default-capabilities.title: default-capabilities config

deny-insecure.$comment: Allowed values are defined by drivers
deny-insecure.description: Set which insecure features are not allowed to run in this server's sessions. Features are defined on a driver level; see documentation for more details. Features listed here will not be enabled even if also listed in "allow-insecure", and even if "relaxed-security" is enabled. If string, a path to a text file containing policy or a comma-delimited list.
deny-insecure.title: deny-insecure config

driver.description: Driver-specific configuration. Keys should correspond to driver package names
driver.title: driver config

keep-alive-timeout.description: Number of seconds the Appium server should apply as both the keep-alive timeout and the connection timeout for all requests. A value of 0 disables the timeout.
keep-alive-timeout.title: keep-alive-timeout config

log.description: Also send log output to this file
log.title: log config

log-filters.description: One or more log filtering rules
log-filters.title: log-filters config

log-no-colors.description: Do not use color in console output
log-no-colors.title: log-no-colors config

long-stacktrace.description: Add long stack traces to log entries. Recommended for debugging only.
long-stacktrace.title: long-stacktrace config

no-perms-check.description: Do not check that needed files are readable and/or writable
no-perms-check.title: no-perms-check config

nodeconfig.$comment: Selenium Grid 3 is unmaintained and Selenium Grid 4 no longer supports this file.
nodeconfig.description: Path to configuration JSON file to register Appium as a node with Selenium Grid 3; otherwise the configuration itself
nodeconfig.title: nodeconfig config

plugin.description: Plugin-specific configuration. Keys should correspond to plugin package names
plugin.title: plugin config

relaxed-security.description: Disable additional security checks, so it is possible to use some advanced features, provided by drivers supporting this option. Only enable it if all the clients are in the trusted network and it's not the case if a client could potentially break out of the session sandbox. Specific features can be overridden by using "deny-insecure"
relaxed-security.title: relaxed-security config

strict-caps.description: Cause sessions to fail if desired caps are sent in that Appium does not recognize as valid for the selected device
strict-caps.title: strict-caps config

tmp.description: Absolute path to directory Appium can use to manage temp files. Defaults to C:\Windows\Temp on Windows and /tmp otherwise.
tmp.title: tmp config

trace-dir.description: Absolute path to directory Appium can use to save iOS instrument traces; defaults to <tmp>/appium-instruments
trace-dir.title: trace-dir config

use-drivers.appiumCliDescription: A list of drivers to activate. Can be a comma-delimited string or path to CSV file. By default, all installed drivers will be activated. Windows environments may require wrapping the comma-delimited string with quotes to escape the comma.
use-drivers.description: A list of drivers to activate. By default, all installed drivers will be activated.
use-drivers.title: use-drivers config

use-plugins.appiumCliDescription: A list of plugins to activate. Can be a comma-delimited string, path to CSV file, or the string "all" to use all installed plugins. Windows environments may require wrapping the comma-delimited string with quotes to escape the comma.
use-plugins.description: A list of plugins to activate. To activate all plugins, the value should be an array with a single item "all".
use-plugins.title: use-plugins config

webhook.$comment: This should probably use a uri-template format to restrict the protocol to http/https
webhook.description: Also send log output to this http listener
webhook.title: webhook config

ssl-cert-path.description: Full path to the .cert file if TLS is used. Must be provided together with "ssl-key-path"
ssl-cert-path.title: .cert file path

ssl-key-path.description: Full path to the .key file if TLS is used. Must be provided together with "ssl-cert-path"
ssl-key-path.title: .key file path

server.title: server config

title: Appium Configuration
